item.title: Korean Conflict Data
item.description: Looking at data from kaggle that shows data on the Korean Conflict. First we need to import the libraries: library(dplyr) library(ggplot2) library(stringr) library(lubridate) Then import the data: kc <- read.csv('KoreanConflict.csv', header = TRUE, stringsAsFactors = FALSE) #import the data colnames(kc) ## [1] "SERVICE_TYPE" "SERVICE_CODE" "ENROLLMENT" ## [4] "BRANCH" "RANK" "PAY_GRADE" ## [7] "POSITION" "BIRTH_YEAR" "SEX" ## [10] "HOME_CITY" "HOME_COUNTY" "NATIONALITY" ## [13] "STATE_CODE" "HOME_STATE" "MARITAL_STATUS" ## [16] "ETHNICITY" "ETHNICITY_1" "ETHNICITY_2" ## [19] "DIVISION" "INCIDENT_DATE" "FATALITY_YEAR" ## [22] "FATALITY_DATE" "HOSTILITY_CONDITIONS" "FATALITY" ## [25] "BURIAL_STATUS" #show the column names Look at the incident dates to see how to find a problem with the data and fix it:
